H0.text: Tying identical weights to two strings of different lengths is the investigation that best answers whether the length of a string changes how fast a pendulum swings.

H1.text: Tie two different weights to a string is the investigation that would best answer the question of whether the length of a string changes how fast a pendulum swings.

H2.text: Tie identical weights to a long string is the investigation that would best answer the question of whether the length of a string changes how fast a pendulum swings.

H3.text: Tie two different weights to two identical strings is the investigation that would best answer whether the length of a string changes how fast a pendulum swings.

A4.text: The period of a pendulum is affected by its length, as demonstrated by the seconds pendulum which has a specific length for a given period.

A5.text: The period of a pendulum varies with factors such as the mass of the string or rod, indicating that mass can influence the period.
